creator: bettlertho@sis.unibe.ch
text:
If i submit an array using a html form with POST method, e.g.

<from action=... method="POST">
<input name="test[]" value="abc">
<input name="test[]" value="def">

this results in

$_POST["test"]=array(
   [0] = abc
   [1] = def
   [2] = abc
   [3] = def

Please show the data sent to Apache by the client using tcpdump or strace
or some other tool.

(Also, that's a pretty old version of Apache 2.  Lots of things have been fixed
since then.)
creator: trawick@apache.org
nd@perlig.de
text:
I'm sure, it's a configuration problem. See
<http://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=18648>. The Inputfilter is probably added twice.

This should be quite easy to detect for the PHP input filter. Perhaps it's
already done right now.

Thanks for using Apache.
